intro: Bornmuellera dieckii, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil, and belongs to the Malvaceae family. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. It produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded understory conditions.
